head.supplied: Octo 22d ¶ Baron von Mueller ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ Will you be so good as to inform me to what class of grasses the enclosed specimen belongs, ¶ if it has a particular name and if it is an indigenous or an impo...

div.p: Z83/10272, unit 1417, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
MS annotations by M: ' Bromus sterilis, Linné ' and 'Answ. 23/10/83. F.v.M'. Letter not found. The letter is filed with M to G. Berry, 24 October 1883. Octo 22d
'(1883)' has been added to the date in an unknown hand.

Will you be so good as to inform me to what class of grasses the enclosed specimen belongs,
The specimen is also included in the file. if it has a particular name and if it is an indigenous or an imported grass.
It is good feed while young but the seed when ripe is fatal to sheep by penetrating through the skin into the flesh
This grass is common around Melbourne and has during the last few years made its appearance on the Murray River

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to remain

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
